title: East Jerusalem
summary: East Jerusalem or Eastern Jerusalem (Arabic: القدس الشرقية‎, al-Quds ash-Sharqiya; Hebrew: מִזְרַח יְרוּשָׁלַיִם‎, Mizraḥ Yerushalayim) is the sector of Jerusalem that was occupied by Jordan during the 1948 Arab–Israeli War, as opposed to the western sector of the city, West Jerusalem, which was occupied by Israel.[lower-alpha 1] Since the 1967 Arab–Israeli War, East Jerusalem has been considered to be occupied by Israel by the international community.
